programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: On the banks of the Siagne In Corsica, soap-making is definitely on the up. After the floods that devastated the Roya Valley, nursery growers and volunteers help the locals to replant their ravaged gardens. In Mandelieu-la-Napoule, the banks of the River Siagne are at the heart of an urban project. Don't panic: Olympe's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Decision time It's time for the results: three candidates must leave the project. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Ramara, Ontario
Behind the walls of a house: an invasion of bees! Louis will do his best to resolve this case.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Rudimentary cuisine Christian gathers everyone together for a rudimentary meal with a recipe from François Papineau, conserves from Bob le Chef and fondu from Réal Bossé. Mathieu Hébert grills the meat and smokes the fish without a stove or a pan. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: The peony garden Katharina Shepherd spent ten years living in Japan, which was where she developed her passion for peonies. In her magnificent garden with a view of Lake Thun, she grows a range of rare species. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Conciergerie to explore the fascinating Gothic monument. Joséphine Fossey talks about Atelier 27 and her creative partnership with Florence Lipszyc. The spiciest addresses in the French capital. Between tradition and modernity, a focus on artistic metalwork and the sublime craftsmanship of the Steaven Richard workshop. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: The Vallée-aux-Loups You can't make a hat without the block that shapes the felt. A block-maker reveals all the secrets of his craft. We take a look at the best plants for permaculture. Made famous by Châteaubriand, the Vallée-aux-Loups offers a botanical stroll in a bucolic setting. Don't panic: David's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Finding an objective The newly-assembled expedition team and the guide Denis Burdet are heading for Rifugio Monzino, at 2,600 metres in altitude, the first stage of their climb up Mont-Blanc. The team must choose a faraway objective for the expedition, ideally with an untouched peak for their first climb. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Brock and East York, Ontario
In Brock, Ontario, Louis saves the life of a large number of frogs. In Toronto, he comes to the rescue of six skunks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.sub-title: Le best of de la saison
programme.desc: Season's highlights For this final programme, Katharina Locher catches up with the gardeners in an exceptional spot: the MFO Park in Zurich. Between walls and columns of greenery, they look back at the best moments of the season. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Bordeaux court of appeal. Textile designer Sophie Mallebranche weaves metal thread using innovative industrial techniques. Discovering the Paris of the workers. A poetic stroll in the area around Rouen, where the porcelain sculptures by the ceramist Marik Korus take the colour white to another level. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: Fun, colourful and made in France, Jean-Simon Roch's creations impress both young and old alike. The designer invites us to explore his magical world. Then, to discover all there is to know about wood, we meet the cabinetmaker Morgane Ricada. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 1

A little crooked house... but can a house really be crooked, literally? Who lives in a villa with direct lake access? How to blossom in a rainbow-coloured house next to a railway line? Viola Tami invites us to discover some surprising buildings and their occupants. Presented by: Viola Tami.

Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Aravis, around Annecy
Laurent invites us to join him as he discovers this region between Lake Annecy and the Aravis mountain range, as seen by those who live there.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: An invitation to explore behind the scenes at the Villa Arnaga in Combo-les-Bains, built by Edmond Rostand. An elegant immersion in the world of the designer Valentine Gauthier. A journey through Paris to discover the best Portuguese addresses. Focus on the sculptor Franck Espagnet who gives new life to driftwood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Bora-Bora (Polynésie française) Découverte des marchands des bords de route de Bora-Bora. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: The Vallée-aux-Loups You can't make a hat without the block that shapes the felt. A block-maker reveals all the secrets of his craft. programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Mancelles Alps
At the GAEC de la Phacélie, deep in the hills and valleys of the Mancelles Alps, Gaël collects propolis from his hives. Cyril and Florence grow Damask roses. One thing is clear: catching butterflies is no easy business! All about the Confrérie des Fins Goustiers du Haut-Maine et Pail.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Warming yourself in Haut-Doubs: mission impossible? Spanning Doubs, Switzerland and Jura, at an altitude of 1,000 metres we find the Val de Mouthe. In the white wonderland of Haut-Doubs, you'd be forgiven for thinking that you're at the North Pole, in the forests of Lapland. Is it possible to get warm in Haut-Doubs ? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 7:

In Vanves, a visit to Pierre Basse's wrought iron workshop. All about the apron. In Lille, Le Colonel is a company specialising in the artisanal manufacture of bow ties, ties and braces. How to wear asymmetric clothing. In Romans-sur-Isère, Un Si Beau Pas makes luxury footwear.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Sébastien Ripari
Expert in international gastronomy, Sébastien Ripari reveals a little-known Paris, one of narrow cobbled streets, busy everyday markets, culinary institutions and secret addresses. For the "friend of the chefs", the French capital is a celebration, preferably involving glorious food and shared with friends.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a nomadic family The Roldan-Forest family have lived, worked and schooled their children in their bus for the last seven years. What made the couple want to offer their children this alternative lifestyle? Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken pizzas and a honey-miso salmon bowl
Two recipes for easy meals that don't compromise on taste: chicken pizza on butter naan bread and a quick honey-miso marinated salmon bowl.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: The last resort On the Crozon Peninsula, the Flotille 33F helicopter squadron specialises in rescue missions. At the controls of their giant Caiman helicopters, the handful of pilots are ready to intervene day or night, whatever the weather, or almost. They offer a last hope for sailors in danger, the last resort. Report by: Grégoire Gosset. Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica of Saint Severinus, Bordeaux. Designer and plastic artist, Jules Levasseur stretches, transforms and cuts materials to give them a second life. We discover the traces Pablo Picasso left of his work in Paris. An immersion in the world of the mosaic artist Béatrice Serre. Presented by: Katherina Marx
